perturbation.original_text: 3.4 ACCEPTANCE OF MILESTONE DELIVERABLE; CHANGE REQUESTS Client will notify Developer in writing of any failure of a Milestone Deliverable to comply with the Specifications, or of any other objections, corrections, changes or amendments required (a Change Request), within ten (10) days of such Milestone's Acceptance Test Date. Any Change Request shall be sufficient to identify, with clarity, any objection, correction, change or amendment to such Milestone Deliverable. In the absence of a Change Request from Client within the time periods detailed herein, the Milestone Deliverable will be deemed accepted by Client.
perturbation.changed_text: 3.4 ACCEPTANCE OF MILESTONE DELIVERABLE; CHANGE REQUESTS Client will notify Developer in writing of any failure of a Milestone Deliverable to comply with the Specifications, or of any other objections, corrections, changes or amendments required (a Change Request), within ten (10) days of such Milestone's Acceptance Test Date. Any Change Request shall be sufficient to identify, with clarity, any objection, correction, change or amendment to such Milestone Deliverable. In the absence of a Change Request from Client within twenty (20) days of such Milestone's Acceptance Test Date, the Milestone Deliverable will be deemed accepted by Client.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces an in-text contradiction by modifying the deadline for the client to submit a Change Request. Originally, the deadline was ten (10) days after the Acceptance Test Date. The changed text extends this deadline to twenty (20) days. This contradicts the original intent of having a quick acceptance process, creating ambiguity.

perturbation.original_text: 11.1 TERMINATION WITHOUT CAUSE Either Party may terminate this Agreement at any time during the term of this Agreement for any reason upon two weeks written notice to the other Party. Upon termination of this Agreement for any reason: (a) all provision of Service and Deliverables by Developer will immediately cease; (b) Client will pay Fees or all Services and Deliverables provided by Developer to Client up to and including the ate of termination; and (c) in compliance with Section 6.1 of this Agreement, Developer will transfer all Works to Client as of the date of termination.
perturbation.changed_text: 11.1 TERMINATION WITHOUT CAUSE Either Party may terminate this Agreement at any time during the term of this Agreement for any reason upon two weeks written notice to the other Party. Upon termination of this Agreement for any reason: (a) all provision of Service and Deliverables by Developer will immediately cease; (b) Client will pay Fees for all Services and Deliverables provided by Developer to Client up to and including thirty (30) days after the date of termination; and (c) in compliance with Section 6.1 of this Agreement, Developer will transfer all Works to Client as of the date of termination.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces an in-text contradiction regarding the client's payment obligations upon termination. The original text states that the client will pay fees up to the date of termination. The altered text extends this payment obligation to thirty (30) days *after* the termination date. This creates confusion and uncertainty about the client's financial obligations after the agreement is terminated.

perturbation.original_text: 5.4 PAYMENT Client shall pay Fees, Expenses (if any), and any Bonus to Developer via w re to Developer's bank account at: Chase Bank 1955 156th Avenue NE Bellevue, Washington 98007 425-590-4010 Routing: 325070760 Account :676313880
perturbation.changed_text: 5.4 PAYMENT Client shall pay Fees, Expenses (if any), and any Bonus to Developer via wire to Developer's bank account at: Chase Bank 1955 156th Avenue NE Bellevue, Washington 98007 425-590-4010 Routing: 123456789 Account :987654321
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction by modifying the routing and account numbers for the developer's bank. If the original bank details are valid and another section refers to this payment information, then the altered payment information will lead to confusion in which bank the client has to make the transfer to. This could lead to delayed payments, disputes and a potential breach of contract.
